learning_goal: Prepare for a startup pitch to Chinese investors

activities.description: Learn essential business vocabulary related to startups, investment, and financial terms. Utilize AI-powered flashcard apps for personalized learning.
Focus on polite speech structures and sentence patterns used in formal business settings. Use AI-powered grammar exercises and interactive tools.
Listen to recordings of business presentations and interviews in Mandarin. Practice active listening and note-taking skills.
Practice introducing yourself, your startup, and your business plan in Mandarin. Use AI-powered voice assistants for pronunciation feedback.
Research common Chinese business etiquette. Find out about typical cultural expectations and norms for meetings and negotiations

weeks.theme: Startup Pitch Structure and Investment Terms

activities.description: Learn Chinese vocabulary related to business plans, investment models, financial metrics, and your specific industry. Utilize AI-powered vocabulary builders.
Read articles or summaries about successful Chinese startups and venture capital firms. Understand their approaches and styles.
Practice your startup pitch in Mandarin. Use AI-powered feedback tools to improve your delivery and content.
Outline your pitch and practice delivering it in Mandarin. Prepare visuals/slides in Chinese.
Learn vocabulary related to negotiation techniques, objections, and answering questions in Mandarin. Utilize AI-powered vocabulary builders.
Analyze and transcribe sample business negotiation videos in Mandarin, paying attention to tone and body language.
Practice handling potential objections and Q&A during your pitch using AI-powered role-playing tools.

Rehearse your pitch with feedback from a native speaker (or an AI-powered tutor) and a mock audience. Focus on delivering your presentation fluently, and managing unexpected situations. Use AI-powered tools to practice and get feedback.
Review all learned vocabulary, grammar, and phrases. Use AI-powered tools to create personalized reviews.
Record and review your pitch multiple times, focusing on fluency and clarity. Use AI-powered tools for pronunciation and intonation feedback.
Practice your pitch with native Mandarin speakers simulating investor meetings. Record these meetings for self-assessment.
Finalize your pitch and presentation materials. Do thorough research about the investors and their investment interests. This should include practicing potential questions from the investors.
